Hey Eb,

> I like this point.  From a reach perspective, we should think mo=
re of the
> other agents/intermediaries that would have no clue on how to h=
andle this
> media type (if they needed too).  Regardless, the receiver (in=
 a lot of
> cases) will need to understand the extensions to an existing me=
dia type.

If a client or intermediary doesn't understand a media type then=
 all bets are off - the client or intermediary doesn't understand the servi=
ce's contract.

Some clients know about lots of media types (e.g. browsers)=
 some clients know about few media types (e.g. Restbucks systems). That's t=
he essence of reach.

Jim
